TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE , in accordance with PERSON no . CARDINAL regarding the distribution of lands to farmers in need , a plot of land measuring QUANTITY on LOC , in LOC of GPE , was sold to GPE by the ORG authorities and registered in his name .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE , pursuant to Law no . PERSON , ORG conducted a boundary - marking exercise ( tahdit çalışması ) on LOC . The purpose of this exercise was to detect the forest areas which had not been included on the cadastral map . The outcome of the evaluation was publicly announced and as no opposition was made , this decision became definitive in DATE . It was concluded that the whole of LOC had the characteristics of a forest and it therefore could not be the subject of private ownership . This conclusion was annotated in the title deed registry in DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE PERSON signed an agreement with the applicant , promising to sell the land in question .

CARDINAL . DATE , ORG conducted an evaluation ( aplikasyon çalışması ) of the area to detect the lands which had lost their characteristics as a forest and to remove their forest status . Its decision was announced on DATE . It was concluded that the plot of land in question had not lost its characteristics as a forest within the meaning of LAW no.CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant purchased the land in question and registered it in his name .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON filed an action before ORG against ORG and ORG , objecting to ORG decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held that it had no jurisdiction to examine the case and transferred the file to ORG . ORG appealed against this decision . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of the first - instance court on procedural grounds . The case was remitted to ORG . On DATE the court declared that it had no jurisdiction to examine the case and transferred the file to ORG . The proceedings resumed before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to annul ORG decision of DATE and to remove the land 's forest status . Furthermore , it ordered that the land be registered in the name of the ORG .

CARDINAL . Both parties appealed against the decision . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of the first - instance court . It held that forests could not be the subject of private ownership and therefore could not be distributed to landless farmers for agricultural purposes . Any property claim over a forest was therefore considered legally invalid . The court found that PERSON was not entitled to request the removal of the land 's forest status .
CARDINAL . The case was resumed before ORG . On DATE ORG maintained its initial decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG and ORG filed an appeal . On DATE ORG of ORG supported the reasoning of the relevant chamber of ORG and quashed the decision of ORG . The case file was sent back to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to abide by the decision of ORG of ORG . It consequently dismissed PERSON 's case and held that there was no legal benefit for private persons to act as a plaintiff in cases concerning the revocation of forest status .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG initiated proceedings before ORG against PERSON to annul the registration of title and for an order preventing further use of the land by PERSON On DATE the applicant intervened in the proceedings . On DATE ORG decided that it had no jurisdiction to examine the case and transferred the file to ORG .
CARDINAL . In DATE the court decided to stay the proceedings as the determination of the case depended on the outcome of the case pending before ORG ( see paragraphs CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . Following the decision of ORG of ORG , the proceedings before ORG resumed ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . On DATE , in view of the decision of ORG of ORG , the first instance court held that the plot of land in dispute was designated as part of a forest area and could not be the subject of private ownership . It therefore decided to annul the applicant 's title and register the land in question in the name of the ORG . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the applicant 's grounds for appeal unfounded and upheld the decision of the first instance court .
